revised_title: Description and Characteristics of a New Species of Smooth-Skinned, Toothless Fish
tldr: This article describes a new species of smooth-skinned, toothless fish discovered by Ralph Bigland and documented by C. Mortimer. The fish has unique features such as a single erect fin on its back, no scales or teeth, and a large, forked tail fin. The author also provides information about the fish's size, coloration, and habitat, as well as its culinary value in Guinea. The fish is called Opah and is known to be good for eating.
